creator: Will_W_76
title: Soda Can Theremin
description: This project demonstrates how to build a simple theremin on a breadboard using a soda can as the antenna. The theremin modulates pitch based on hand position relative to the can.
steps: Gather all the necessary materials, including the Analog Discovery kit, op-amps, resistors, capacitors, diode, speaker, soda can, and breadboard.
Build the variable-frequency oscillator using an OP27 op-amp, resistors, and a capacitor. Connect the soda can and a green jumper wire to the circuit to act as the antenna and input.

Construct the weighted summer using another OP27 op-amp, resistors, and a breadboard pin. Connect the output of the oscillator to the weighted summer, and the Analog Discovery's Arbitrary Waveform Generator as the fixed oscillator input.
Create the envelope detector with a small-signal diode, resistor, and capacitor. Connect the output of the weighted summer to the input of the envelope detector.
Set up the inverting amplifier using an OP37 op-amp and resistors. Connect the output of the envelope detector to the input of the amplifier.
Review the entire circuit, connect the power supplies and the speaker. Attach the Analog Discovery to the circuit as instructed.

Open the Digilent WaveForms software, turn on the Voltage Instrument, and measure the output frequency of the variable-frequency oscillator. Set the WaveForm Generator frequency to this measured value. Run the waveform generator and play the theremin by moving your hand near the soda can.
